Adress: 13 rue de la Paix, 75002 Paris France
Description: An utterly sophisticated choice that is without equal among the luxury hotels of Paris; the Hôtel Westminster is considered by many to be the Crown Jewel of authentic, historical Paris hotels. Named after the Duke of Westminster, who resided in this sumptuous property in the 19th Century, the Hotel Westminster is a luxury hotel offering magnificent rooms and suites.
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Dutch and 1 more

Name: Sonder L'Edmond Parc Monceau
Description:
The flutter of butterflies in your chest. That tingling sense of anticipation. A familiar yet foreign feeling you wish you could bottle and keep forever. Is it magic? Sandstone buildings framed by leafy tree-lined avenues. Elegance flows through L’Edmond like honey. Once home to renowned writer Edmond Rostand, this intimate mansion will give you a true Parisian experience. Make your way through the hotel, past the wrought-iron detailed front door and glistening chandelier, until you find yourself in your private space. Drop your bags and settle in. Flâner the streets of the 17th Arrondissement under the 18th-century architecture. Saunter the art-filled rooms of Musée Nissim de Camondo. Then enjoy a breath of fresh air at picturesque Parc Monceau. Espresso in one hand and croissant aux amandes in the other, cozy up on the sidewalk terrace of Restaurant Brigitte and watch this passionate city move around you.
Read more

Name: Hotel Sacha
Description: Discover a cosy theatrical boutique hotel in the heart of Paris lively theater district: the Hotel Sacha. The decoration of this establishment with 46 rooms immerses the traveler in the world of entertainment and excitement of Paris. Some of our rooms have a balcony and others an italian shower. Points of interest : Montmartre 10 min walking distance Opera & Department stores 20 min walk - Champs Elysées direct by Metro Line 2 (Pigalle) - Porte de Versailles direct by metro line 12 (St Georges) - Shuttles to airport
Language_Spoken: English, French, Arabic, Italian and 3 more

Name: Kimpton St Honore Paris
Description: Moments away from the Opera House, the iconic department stores, the Faubourg St Honoré and the Tuileries Garden, Kimpton St Honoré Paris features 149 beautifully appointed guestrooms and suites, a Californian-inspired restaurant and bar with patio and live music, a spa with an indoor pool and state-of-the-art Technogym, and, cerise sur le gâteau, a rooftop bar with 360° views over Paris.

Name: Hotel du College de France
Description: Family and cosy hotel, run by Monsieur Jean Marc TALTAVULL since 1999 , we will always be handsome with you and happy to provide the best service ! In a very quiet street, in the heart of the Quartier Latin, discover a charming hotel ! Located above the commanderie de Saint Jean de Latran, we help with a deep White Knights spirit. By visiting us, you will experience good vibes only ;-)

Name: Hotel Ekta
Description:
With a design inspired by the 70s, modern, contemporary, signed Jean-Philippe Nuel and Natasha Stojkovic, the hotel Ekta Paris invite you to live under the charm of fashion two steps away from the famous Champs-Elysees and Arc de Triomphe. Chic and warm, the Ekta is a Boutique Hotel 4 star Deluxe, unique and unusual, in a legendary district, close to the Avenue George V and the Lido, near to Avenue Montaigne, the Grand Palais and the Petit Palais and the shops of major French brands like Louis Vuitton, Cartier, Laduree ... Perfect for a romantic weekend, a business trip or an original stay, the hotel Ekta has 25 rooms including 5 suites, comfortable and trendy design. Decoration in homage to fashion, warm and efficient welcome: Ekta hotel makes you live an exceptional journey in Paris between the Arc de Triomphe and Place de la Concorde.
Read more
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Arabic and 2 more

Name: Suites & Hotel Helzear Etoile
Description:
Just steps away from the Champs Elysées and the Place de l’Etoile, our 29 Suites and apartments welcome you in the centre of the prestigious 8th arrondissement in a magnificent Haussmannian building. You will be surprised to discover that in this very heart of Paris you will enjoy the peace and quiet of our terrace and why not, on sunny days, have breakfast or a glass of champagne outside. We wish to make you live like Parisians from the neighbourhood: you will enjoy the comfort of a prestigious hotel while having the choice to retreat in your Parisian cocoon to prepare yourself a simple meal as all our Suites are equipped with kitchenettes. Enjoy Paris as you wish! Our 29 Suites and apartments, recently decorated, all different are spread over 4 floors with lift. We carefully selected noble material, bright colours and character furniture to respect the spirit of this beautiful Parisian property. Our Suites and apartments can take a number of layouts: from the loft spirit with an upstairs bedroom to the typical ground floor Haussmannian apartment. In each Suite, you can make the choice to retreat from the Parisian buzz and to allow yourself a true Parisian moment by cooking your own meal, at home, while benefiting from prestigious hotel services. A neighbourhood in the Golden Triangle: steps away from the Champs Elysées and the Arc de Triomphe, you will be lucky to live like the few privileged Parisians of the area. Besides the local touristic monuments, museums and attractive shops, we are ideally located for your business or family travels. Discover below all the opportunities to wander around Paris and its surroundings from the hotel. We are well located to make the most of the beautiful Parisian monuments: • Arc de Triomphe, 8 minutes’ walk • Eiffel Tower, 20 minutes’ walk • Alexandre III Bridge, 20 minutes’ walk • Alma Bridge, Liberty Flame, 10 minutes’ walk • Invalides, 30 minutes’ walk On the shopping side, you will be spoiled too! We are located: • 2 minutes’ walk from the Champs Élysées • 3 minutes’ walk from the George V Avenue • 10 minutes’ walk from the Avenue Montaigne If you are here for business reasons, we are: • 3 minutes’ walk from the George V Metro station (M°1) • 10 minutes’ walk from the Metro and RER Charles de Gaulle Etoile station (M° 1, M°2, M°6, RER A) • 8 minutes’ walk from the Alma-Marceau station (M°9) • 10 minutes by car from Porte Maillot, 2 Metro stops from Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro station (M°1) • 15 minutes by RER or Metro from business area La Défense from Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro station (M°1 or RER A) And if you have time to explore the Parisian museums, you are best placed for: • Yves Saint Laurent Foundation, 5 minutes’ walk • Palais de Tokyo, 10 minutes’ walk • Modern Art Museum, 10 minutes’ walk • Galliera Museum, 10 minutes’ walk • Asian Arts National Museum, 10 minutes’ walk Finally, if you are here with your family, nothing could be easier! • Disneyland Paris: 45 minutes by RER A from Charles de Gaulle Etoile station • Palace of Versailles: 30 minutes by RER C from Pont de l’Alma station
Read more
Language_Spoken: English, French, Russian, Spanish and 4 more

Name: Hotel Elixir
Adress: 7 rue Jean Lantier 1st Arr., 75001 Paris France
Description:
Independent hotel with central location, open 24 hours. 30 bedrooms in the heart of paris in a quite street near from everything, refurbished in 2009 and 2nd semester 2013.Every room has air conditioning, double glass, TV with satellite including CNN & BBC, minibar, safe for a laptop up to 15 inch, telephone, free WiFi, Ipod alarm clock player, iron & board, hair dryer, bathtub or large shower, kettle with tea and coffee facility, ecologic welcome products, quality hanger.Our entry has a ramp access, our lift, breakfast room and one room are able to welcome any hand wheelchair.We do speak french, english, spanish & russian. A computer is available 24 hours at the lobby. Services available : airport shuttle, restaurant table, baby sitting, laundry. A baby cot, nat, baby chair and boiling baby bottle are available (free services).Do not hesitate to contact us for any information. During the day, Victoria, Virginie or Laurent will be pleased to guide you !
Read more
Language_Spoken: English, French, Russian, Spanish and 1 more

Name: Novotel Paris 14 Porte d'Orleans
Description:
The Novotel Paris 14 Porte d'Orléans is a 4 star hotel located at the gateway of the 14th district and Gare Montparnasse, 3 minutes from the metro 4 and trams T3a Porte d'Orléans which will lead you to the Paris Expo Porte de Versailles, and 5 minutes from RER B Denfert-Rochereau. The hotel with free WIFI offers spacious, soundproofed and air conditioned rooms, restaurant, bar, fitness room and private parking. Ideal hotel for a business trip or family. The spacious rooms, entirely renovated in 2017, are equipped with satellite TV and tea / coffee, a private bathroom Up to 2 children under 16 stay free when sharing their parents' room. The Novotel Cafe restaurant and bar are available for breakfast, lunch, dinner. From the metro station Porte d'Orleans, you can join directly the Latin Quarter and Notre Dame Saint-Michel and the Luxembourg Gardens. You also can get to the Eiffel Tower in 20 minutes by Metro.
Read more

Name: Hotel Vice Versa
Adress: 213 rue de la Croix Nivert, 75015 Paris France
Description:
Among the last-born concept Parisian hotels, the Vice Versa Hotel is pleased to welcome you into a world where sin suddenly becomes a source of joy and fulfillment ...Paris is the city of emotions, pleasures and temptations. Lust, envy, sloth, gluttony, pride, greed or wrath ... it is easy and sometimes nice to fall into one of these deadly sins! Vice Versa Hotel, an interior design by Chantal Thomass.To carry out your wishes, the Vice Versa Hotel offers a contemporary and uniquely designed and very Parisian hotel, like its famous designer and interior designer Chantal Thomass. This passion for fashion has given birth to a completely redesigned and refurbished establishment from top to bottom in order to provide quality services.It is with great pleasure that Chantal Thomass chose the theme of the 7 deadly sins in the entire hotel.
Read more
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Arabic and 2 more

Name: Hotel Le 20 Prieure
Adress: 20 rue du grand Prieure, 75011 Paris France
Description: Design & cosy 3 stars Hotel closed to the neighborhood of the Marais and Republique. 5 metro lines at 300m. Free Wifi access, colored breakfast and friendly staff

Name: Le Petit Chomel
Description: Small boutique hotel of 23 rooms, located near Le Bon Marché, on saint-Germain area. We have different type of rooms, all our rooms are double, with a complete bathroom, with shower or bathtub, with safety box and minibar. All the hotel have air conditionning.
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Arabic and 2 more

Name: Mercure Paris Arc de Triomphe Etoile
Description: A stone's throw from the Champs Elysees (at the foot of the Arc de Triomphe) easily accessible by Metro (lines 1, 2 and 6) and RER A, the Mercure Paris Arc de Triomphe Etoile hotel is ideal for your shopping trips. This hotel has been renovated to meet high quality, environmentally-friendly standards. All rooms combine the principles of color therapy with modern and elegant decor.
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, German and 1 more

Name: Hotel AVAMA Prony
Adress: 103 B avenue de Villiers 17th Arr., 75017 Paris France
Description:
Ideally located in the Pereire / Maréchal Juin district, at the end of Avenue de Villiers in the 17th arrondissement of Paris, Avama Prony is an elegant 3*** hotel. A sophisticated decoration with a typically Parisian spirit and a "like home" feeling. Chic and urban, the hotel respects its environment and offers its guests comfort and adapted services. Taken over in April 2019 by a new family management team, AVAMA Prony hotel has equipped the entire building with air conditioning and has redesigned all the decoration. The focus is on digital for an ever more pleasant and personalised stay. Hotel Avama Prony is close to the main Parisian means of transport within a 50 m radius (metro Pereire, RER D, Taxis, Bus or bicycles). We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Hotel de Prony as you experience all of the things Paris has to offer.
Read more

Name: Le Belleval
Adress: 16 rue de la Pepiniere, 75008 Paris France
Description: In the heart of the 8th arrondissement of Paris, our 4-star hotel invites for a unique and timeless experience combining elegance and peacefullness.

Name: Hotel Les Jardins de la Villa
Description:
Located in a quiet discreet street, a stone’s throw away from the Champs-Elysees and Palais des Congres, Les Jardins de la Villa is the perfect pied-a-terre for your business, shopping or sightseeing trip. Conceived as a large private villa with a decidedly couture air, this elegant 4-star hotel embodies Parisian chic with humour and fantasy. A subtle fusion of secret garden poetry, Art and details evocative of the fashion world, the rooms and suites boast sober or audacious colour palettes. Each space is a genuine luxury cocoon where guests will treasure the careful attention to detail. Some open toward blooming ower terraces, others toward the dream-like patio. As soon as spring blossoms, the winter garden’s roof is removed to let sunshine drench the sculptural vegetation. A true hidden treasure right in the middle of Paris.
Read more

Name: La Clef Champs-Elysees Paris
Description: The Haussmannian-style building that houses La Clef Champs-Elysées was built by the Hennessy family in 1907, a stone’s throw from what many consider the most beautiful avenue in the world. A secret garden lies hidden behind the historic building. Discover this magnificent oasis and soak up a unique sensory experience elevated by regal décor.

Name: Hotel Dupond-Smith
Description:
The very heart of Paris’s Marais quarter is home to a completely new signature in hotels. Like a codename, or a password, Dupond-Smith is the key that lets you in to a haven of classic elegance, one that is both unique and custom designed. The eight bedrooms and suites exude the atmosphere of a “select club”, carefully shielded from inquisitive outsiders – a model of intimate refinement where guests know that they can enjoy complete discretion and one of today’s greatest luxuries: choosing to be incognito.It is the ultimate retreat, whose existence is highly confidential. A well-kept secret, known only to insiders. Those in the know mention it only in quiet whispers, in the presence of like-minded connoisseurs of true luxury – luxury that states its case without ostentation, and stands out from the rest without ever drawing attention to itself.
Read more
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Italian and 2 more

Name: Hotel Recamier
Adress: 3 bis Place Saint Sulpice, 75006 Paris France
Description:
Discreetly nestled behind the trees on Place Saint Sulpice in the heart of Saint Germain des Prés area, Hotel Récamier is about to become a new exclusive address in Paris. The hotel should meet the expectations of travellers in search of confidential addresses such as those exchanged between well travelled and demanding friends.Half of the 24 rooms have a direct view on the place. The rooms have been superbly revamped by the renowned interior designer Jean Louis Deniot who was inspired to create 24 entirely different rooms with one theme per floor. On a classical basis he has added some eclecticism inspired by the various 20th century decorative styles. You will find neither hyper exuberance nor minimalism: here we are talking real Parisian elegance.
Read more

Name: Hotel Eden Montmartre
Description: A charming little hotel, classic and modern at the same time. Confortable bedding, intimate cozy setting and full, private bathrooms. Situated in the Montmartre area (the most visited in Paris), we are well based in Paris and easily accessed by car. There is a public secure parking nearby, their rate is approx 25 € for 24H. Breakfast is served everyday from 6h to 11AM as an open buffet (8.50€). All day long, we put at your disposal complementary coffee, tea and water.

Name: Hotel Keppler
Description:
This gorgeous boutique hotel, by Pierre Yves ROCHON, is definitely not to be missed. In a prestigious address in the centre of the Champs Elysees area and the chic 16th district, the Keppler hotel pays great attention to its guests' comfort. The 34 opulent guest rooms and 5 exquisite suites all have custom-designed furniture, handmade carpets and mouldings and even the lightning is custom-designed by Rochon himself. The top floor suites are just like a jetsetter’s private apartments, intimate and homelike, with superb terraces and balconies overlooking Paris and the Eiffel Tower. This hotel really is the choice of discerning travellers seeking for the very best.
Read more

Name: Hotel Du Midi Paris Montparnasse
Adress: 4 avenue Rene Coty 14th Arr., 75014 Paris France
Description:
Located on the Place Denfert-Rochereau, left bank, in the Montparnasse district, close to the Latin Quarter, the Hotel Du Midi, offers all the comfort, service and amenities for a pleasant stay in Paris. Whether you come for a business trip or a holiday in Paris, the Hôtel du Midi is ideally located, offers room for you among seven categories of rooms. The 45 spacious and newly renovated with air conditioning, satellite TV, courtesy tray, direct dial telephone, Wi-Fi, and private bathroom. You get a very nice neighborhood with restaurants, bars, shops and above all a unique service (RER, Metro and bus at the foot of the hotel) which will allow you access within minutes to all the attractions of Paris.
Read more

Name: Prince de Galles, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Paris
Description:
Prince de Galles, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Paris is a legendary 5-star jewel of the Parisian Art Deco movement. Since its inauguration in 1929, the Prince de Galles has excelled as a symbol of sophistication and grace in Paris, France. The hotel has 159 rooms, including 43 suites. The hotel is located on the avenue George V, a 5 minute walk from the Champs-Elysées, the avenue Montaigne, and some of the most celebrated landmarks such as the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. The 19.20, the new Parisian cocktail bar offers, in an intimate and exclusive atmosphere, the opportunity to savor recipes that honor Paris, to discover the realms of cognac, and taste some of the very best wines and champagnes from local producers.
Read more

Name: Ibis Paris Place d'Italie 13eme
Description: The Ibis Paris Place d'Italie 13ème hotel is located in south Paris, 200 m from the Gobelins tapestry factory, 500 m from the Natural History Museum and 1 km from Chinatown. The nearest railway station is 1 km away and Orly airport 20 km. The hotel has 58 air-conditioned rooms with Wifi Internet access, including 3 adapted for disabled persons. A bar, snacks 24/24, public outdoor parking and private covered parking are at your disposal. Pets accepted.

Name: Dress Code
Description:
With its lovely, carefree attitude, the new Hotel Dress Code has the right dose of chic to seduce you. Located in the French Ready-to-Wear association’s former headquarters, it is found at the heart of shopping neighborhoods with a capital “S”: the major department stores, the rue Saint Honoré and the Opera Garnier. Hotel Dress Code conjugates “Fashion” in the most present tense possible with its connecting thread of rooms and moods. Here the well-known clichés of French Couture leisurely unfurl their signatures for your well-being: pastel, acidic atmospheres that recall sixties futurism, nautical sailor stripes anchored in tradition and style, pearly, powder grays with overtones of Avenue Montaigne, suit-smart houndstooth motifs or the super elegance of luxurious wood, leather and terracotta … Dressed by decorator Stéphanie Coutas, the 33 rooms are laid out like a dreamy wardrobe with private terraces in some … and clever charm for everyone!
Read more
Language_Spoken: English, French, Russian, Spanish and 1 more

Name: Exe Panorama
Description: The Exe Panorama Hotel 3* has 43 rooms. Each one of the rooms at the ExePanorama holds a surprise: a large vinyl decoration on the bed headrest, with the silhouette of some symbol of Paris and a fragment of the words of some well-known French song with Parisian references. You could have a Georges Moustaki room, or one called Yves Montand, Georges Brassens, Charles Trenet, Edith Piaf, Jacques Brel, Charles Aznavour or so many others who have make us dance and fall in love to the sound of their voices.

Name: Timhotel Opera Grands Magasins
Adress: 35 rue la Bruyere 9th Arr., 75009 Paris France
Description:
Looking for a place to stay in Paris? Then look no further than Hotel Timhotel Opera Grands Magasins, a hotel that brings the best of Paris to your doorstep.
You’ll enjoy relaxing rooms that offer air conditioning and a desk, and you can stay connected during your stay as Hotel Timhotel Opera Grands Magasins offers guests free wifi.
The hotel features a 24 hour front desk, 24 hour check-in, and a concierge. Plus, Hotel Timhotel Opera Grands Magasins offers breakfast buffet, providing a pleasant respite from your busy day. For guests with a vehicle, parking is available.
Read more

Name: Paris Marriott Opera Ambassador Hotel
Description: Discover Paris and luxury like never before at Paris Marriott Opera Ambassador Hotel. Our perfectly located hotel in Paris, France sits nestled in the heart of the Opera District, the Galeries Lafayette and Palais Garnier are just steps away. Enjoy 4-star accommodations and amenities here, along with elegant French cuisine at 16 Haussmann and a state-of-the-art fitness center all within our doors.

Name: Hotel Beige
Description: Hotel Beige is happy to announce you the Grand Opening on October 18th!
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Arabic and 2 more

Name: Hotel des Trois Colleges
Description:
Everyone needs a place to lay their weary head. For travelers visiting Paris, Hotel des Trois Colleges is an excellent choice for rest and rejuvenation. Well-known for its proximity to great restaurants and attractions, Hotel des Trois Colleges makes it easy to enjoy the best of Paris.
Hotel des Trois Colleges is a hotel offering a flat screen TV, air conditioning, and a desk in the rooms, and it is easy to stay connected during your stay as free wifi is offered to guests.
Read more

Name: Hotel Alison
Adress: 21 rue de Surene 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
Description:
Ideal cosy hotel in the city centre of Paris, BEST QUALITY FOR PRICE IN THIS DISTRICT, very safe area in the 8th district. Welcome to the HOTEL ALISON Madeleine St. Honore Hotel, a nice option for travelers like you for tourism and business. Our family has been welcoming guests since 1977. Nearby landmarks such as Champs Elysées, Louvre, Concorde Square, Montmartre (1.4 mn) and Eiffel Tower (1.5 mn) make Alison Madeleine St. Honore Hotel a great place to stay when visiting Paris for leisure or Business. The hotel is perfectly located to go to the Parc des Expositions Porte de Versailles (direct by metro line 12 - 30 minutes), also to Stade de France (direct by metro line 13 - 35 minutes) and Parc des Princes (direct by metro line 9 - 35 minutes) Rooms at Alison Madeleine St. Honore Hotel provide a flat screen TV, and FREE WIFI with Fibre available. In addition, Alison Hotel is proposing a nice French continental breakfast in the nice lounge, which will help make your Paris trip additionally gratifying. During your visit, be sure to check out one of Paris' popular restaurants such as L'Avenue (avenue Montaigne), le grand Restaurant de Jean Francois Piege (gourmet) and its new restaurant Mimosa, and the very charming french bistrot le "Cassenoix"located by the Eiffel Tower: the best Bistrot quality for price in the city !! Plus, during your trip, don’t forget to check out some of the popular museums, like le Louvre, Musée de l’Armée, Hôtel de la Marine (10 minutes walk), Museum Orangerie, Orsay Museum... ALISON HOTEL looks forward to welcoming you on your visit to Paris.
Read more

Name: Citadines Montmartre Paris
Description: Located in a residential street 2 steps away from place Clichy, Citadines Montmatre Paris sits at the foot of the Butte Montmartre, close to the Moulin Rouge and the Europe and Trinité business areas. Montmartre may be famous for its maze of narrow streets and staircases, its vineyard and authentic village atmosphere, where imposing Haussmann and 1930s style buildings rub shoulders with charming houses and tiny gardens; But it's also renowned for its night life- the multitude of cabarets, cafés with resident portraitists.
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Arabic and 3 more

Name: Hotel Galileo
Description:
Two steps away from the famous Champs-Elysees and George V avenues, Arc de Triomphe, haute couture boutiques of avenue Montaigne and major museums (Petit and Grand Palais), come and peacefully visit Paris by staying at the Hotel Galileo. A chic Parisian ambiance is combined with a homey atmosphere to create a new type of contemporary luxury. Heritage of the past (17th century fireplace) is flawlessly combined with a touch of Art Deco designed by our interior decorator, Natasha Stojkovic. You are sure to enjoy Les Jeux de Miroirs, a striking yet elegant work by Tamara de Lempicka, as well as the different walls and surfaces of this unique place. Located in the heart of the exciting Golden Triangle, the luxurious and peaceful 3*** Hotel Galileo is dedicated to elegance, sophistication and has become a true haven of peace with its beautiful patio in the centre of a metropolis rich in culture and history.
Read more

Name: Odeon Hotel
Adress: 3 rue de l Odeon, 75006 Paris France
Description: As fourth-generation hotel owners, we pay special attention to our hotel's ambience, comfort and an impeccable appearance. Our lounge offers residents and their guests an ideal place to relax. Breakfast is served each morning, either in your room from or in the hotel lounge from 7:00 am to 10:30 am
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Arabic and 3 more

Name: Hotel Les Matins de Paris & Spa
Description:
The Hotel Atmosphere You're here. Where? In South Pigalle (Sopi for those in the know) at the heart of a relaxed, trendy area. You're someone who likes to discover a lovely, well-decorated place that has experienced the buzz of many lively decades. Because just so you know, in the 50s and 60s our address was the haunt for some of the city's most artistic inhabitants. Right in this building, Paris' first American restaurant, opened by the dreamer Leroy Haynes, attracted a joyful jumble of musicians from Ray Charles to Marianne Faithfull ... Today why not improvise a friendly meeting or get-together here with a cheerful laziness and nonchalance? Plunge into the voluptuous harmony of the spa, get spontaneous advice from an attentive staff that has the time to listen to you. Do you hear our music? The soul of Matins de Paris clearly sets the tempo for your stay here as you find your own reference points in the most inspired of places ... and neighborhoods.
Read more

Name: Hotel Residence Foch
Description:
Finding an ideal romantic hotel in Paris does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Hotel Residence Foch, a nice option for travelers like you.
Hotel Residence Foch is a romantic hotel offering a flat screen TV in the rooms, and it is easy to stay connected during your stay as free wifi is offered to guests.
The hotel features a 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and baggage storage. Plus, guests can enjoy a lounge, which has made this a popular choice among travelers visiting Paris.
Read more
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Italian and 1 more

Name: Hotel Hor Europe
Description:
With a 24/24, this hotel is 120 meters from the metro station Gare du Nord, which leads directly to the Saint-Michel. It offers free Wi-Fi, a terrace and a small garden. Rooms at the hotel are Hor soundproofed and serviced by a lift. All rooms have modern decor, a flat-screen TV and a private bathroom with a walk-in shower. Some rooms have a private terrace and are suitable for people with reduced mobility. Guests can enjoy a buffet breakfast in the dining room, garden or in the comfort of your room. There are restaurants and cafes within 100 meters of the hotel. You also can park your car in the parking lot of the station and the train station is north for a discount (25% off the list price displayed). The hotel Hor is a 20 minute walk from the Republic Square, 12 minutes walk from the Canal Saint-Martin. The Montmartre district is a 15 minute walk.
Read more
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Arabic and 2 more

Name: Hotel Phileas Lazare & Spa
Adress: 24 rue d Amsterdam 09 Arrondissement, 75009 Paris France
Description: Family boutique hotel in the very centre of Paris, close to the main shopping stores, Galeries Lafayette, in the heart of the business district, a few hundred metres from the main monuments.

Name: Hotel Lutetia
Description:
Hotel Lutetia is an iconic landmark situated in the vibrant Saint-Germain-des-Pres area of Paris and the only luxury grand hotel on the city's Left Bank. Originally opened in 1910, the building's design was a daring move from art nouveau to the emerging style of art deco. The Lutetia delivers an authentic Parisian experience and has been at the heart of the local community for more than 100 years. The hotel now features an eclectic mix of restaurants, bars and lounges throughout the historical ground floor including the return of the Lutetia Brasserie under the supervision of three Michelin starred chef Gerald Passedat. Unique to the area, Akasha Holistic Wellbeing Centre, is Lutetia's 700 sqm/7,500 sqft spa dedicated to wellbeing and fitness featuring a 17m swimming pool bathed in natural daylight.
Read more

Name: Max Hotel
Description:
See why so many travelers make Max Hotel their hotel of choice when visiting Paris. Providing an ideal mix of value, comfort and convenience, it offers a charming setting with an array of amenities designed for travelers like you.
You’ll enjoy relaxing rooms that offer a flat screen TV, air conditioning, and a desk, and you can stay connected during your stay as Max Hotel offers guests free wifi.
The hotel features a 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and newspaper. Plus, Max Hotel offers a lounge, providing a pleasant respite from your busy day. For guests with a vehicle, parking is available.
Read more

Name: Hotel des Grands Boulevards
Description: Welcome to the Hotel des Grands Boulevards, by Experimental Group ! In the heart of Paris, Hotel des Grands Boulevards is a four star hotel, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the busy streets and accessible through our own secret passageway. The hotel is a brand new Parisian place for the well traveled, a blend of modern confort and reminiscence of the French Revolution. Designed by the talented Dorothée Meilichzon.

Name: Hotel Residence Des Arts
Adress: 14 rue Git le Coeur, 75006 Paris France
Description:
The 3 star Hotel Résidence des Arts, is located in rue Git le Coeur, between the Latin Quarter and Saint Germain des Prés, in the historical heart of Paris. The story goes: Gabrielle d’Estrees, duchess of Beaufort & Verneuil, mistress of Henri the IV from 1591 to 1599 used to live in rue Git le Cœur. The king, enamored of his mistress, said while passing by our street with his carriage: "here lies my heart" ("ici git mon coeur"). Each of our elegant rooms have their own decoration, character and colour scheme. You will enjoy every comfort in a refined setting.
Read more

Name: Hotel Petit Lafayette
Description: In the heart of the Paris of Parisians, located rue Lafayette, in the vibrant 9th arrondissement, the 4-star Petit Lafayette boutique hotel is the perfect address for families, romantic getaways, or business trip travelers. Elegant and light-filled, the spacious rooms and suites with a Haussmann-style touch offer all modern comfort, just a stone's throw from the Galeries Lafayette, the Opera Garnier and the main train stations.
Language_Spoken: English, French, Spanish, Arabic and 1 more

Name: Hotel des Marronniers
Description:
Hotel Des Marronniers is a charming hotel tucked in a small courtyard. Our 3 star hotel has kept the intimacy and authenticity of Saint-Germain Des Pres. In the heart of a lively area, peace and tranquility can be found in the rooms overlooking the courtyard or the garden. Because the jewel of this hotel is undoubtedly the garden. In summer, breakfast can be enjoyed in the shade of chestnut trees. Otherwise, breakfast is served between 7:30 am and 11:00 am in the veranda, in the vaulted cellar or in your room. A tea room is available for guests of hotels and passers-by in the veranda, in the garden or beautiful vaulted cellar of the Hotel Des Marronniers. The property is ideally located in the center of the capital. The Louvre Museum, Notre Dame Cathedral or the Luxembourg Gardens are just a few minutes walk. It is the same for the famous Café de Flore and Deux Magots. The rooms are equipped with air conditioning, free Wi-Fi access and a flat-screen TV. Staying at the Hotel Des Marronniers is the promise of a peaceful and romantic night in a mythical district.

Name: Hotel De L'Universite
Description:
The Hotel de l’Université is a former Benedictine convent and has retained many period features while adapting to the needs of 21st century society. The reception area is vast and delightful with its ancient beams. It is an immediate illustration of the style and appeal of this quality establishment. The Hotel de l’Université only has 27 bedrooms, allowing the staff to focus on an individualized care. Each room has its own decor and character, many ornate with ageless beams, but all benefiting from tall traditional Parisian windows allowing daylight to flood in. All the rooms have been renovated in 2011 and include air-conditioning, mini-bar, safety deposit box and a free Wi-Fi connection. A laundry service is available upon request. The rooms on the top floor overlook the rooftops of Paris and some have the rare bonus of a private terrace. The Hotel de l’Université is not a place to stay for the night. It is a journey into the history and style of Parisian life, a chance to experience life as one of the locals and bring back unforgettable memories.

Name: Hotel Mansart
Description:
"A former 17th century private mansion with its rich history" Ideally located on the corner of Place Vendôme and rue des Capucines, a step or two away from the arts and business district, the building in which the Hôtel Mansart was set up was built in 1720. It was designed by Jules-Hardouin Mansart, Louis XIV’s favorite architect, who also designed the Château de Versailles and the Invalides’ dome. The Crown jewelry-maker, Alexandre-Gabriel Lemonnier lived there during the Second Empire. He was involved in making Place Vendôme the jewelry district and made, among others, Empress Eugénie’s crown. The building was turned into a luxury hotel at the end of the 19th century. Even today, each room has kept the traces of past periods in its own way: the 17th century, the Second Empire, the Victorian influence at the end of the 19th century.

Name: Villa Royale Montsouris
Adress: 144 rue de la Tombe Issoire, 75014 Paris France
Description:
How would you know, before actually entering the Villa Royale Montsouris, that you would be crossing the Mediterranean? The lobby, decorated in Andalusian-Moorish style, is a perfect representation of the charms of the Orient. Colonnades and vaulted ceilings, copper, zelliges and wrought iron make the hotel look like a traditional Moroccan riad. Combine the stories of One Thousand and One Nights with draperies, sheer curtains and precious fabrics and the rooms seem to jump straight of oriental palaces. The elements of the decor bring brightly-coloured touches to the place: the reds of the floor tiles and the ochres of the earthenware, the Majorelle blue of the doors, which, when closed, make Paris seem very far away. In this exotic and wonderful universe, the service provided by the attentive staff add a personal note to the unique charm of the establishment, located in a peaceful district of the Capital, near the Parc de Montsouris and the tram that’s a direct connection with the Porte de Versailles Convention and Exhibition Centre.

Description:
Located in the 5th arrondissement, a few steps away from the rue Mouffetard, Pepper & Paper Apartments is a hotel residence designed for travelers wishing to live a unique and authentic experience in the heart of Paris. Pepper & Paper Apartments has 17 studios and apartments, designed by the Roque Interiors agency and are fully equipped. Epicureans will enjoy the wine cellar and the grocery store, and others will satisfy their cravings by borrowing what they want from the object kiosk. From April to September, the garden and its terrace will offer residents a warm and friendly outdoor space, for a well-deserved urban break, in the armchairs, around the ping-pong table, or the pizza oven. All guests will be able to benefit from numerous services and advice and from a team available 24 hours a day to answer all their questions before, during and after their stay.

Fully renovated in an intimate, relaxing and contemporary decor, the Mercure Paris la Sorbonne hotel is ideally located whether your stay is for business or leisure. Soufflot public car park is close by.

Name: Hotel du Rond-Point des Champs-Elysees - Esprit de France
Description:
"A unique Art Deco setting" “Go through the entrance to the early 20th century with its elegant Art Deco canopy overhead and take up residence close to the main sights of Paris.” The Hotel du Rond-Point des Champs-Élysées has belonged to the family of Mrs Villette-Vuitton since the late 19th century. Esprit de France’s recent refurbishments pay tribute to all the original 1920 features, from the Art Deco canopy and marble elements outside to the wine bottle glassware and the tin radiator covers within. The hotel name, “Le Rond Point” (roundabout) evokes an abundancy of styles and genres inciting difference and travel. Refurbishing encompassed carefully selecting each decor to create a poetic, bohemian-chic universe with a hint of nostalgia, as well hunting down antiques to pair with the modern furniture to create a visual and timeless contrast. The result is a delightful feeling of peacefulness, as if time had stopped. The basement now houses a 13-metre pool, which offers the luxury to swim in an art deco setting. The breakfast room and the bar will transport you between a cozy alcove and a multiplied mirrors’ game.

You are only a few minutes' walk from the wonderful history and culture this district is renowned for: the Opera Garnier, Galeries Lafayette, Montmartre and the Musee Grevin. Immerse yourself in the cultural life of Paris and enjoy the many famous theatres within walking distance of the hotel. Enjoy the light and the comfort of our modern, contemporary and welcoming rooms. The panoramic breakfast room with views of the neighbourhood will make you experience the excitement of the district. Our meeting room, fully equipped for 10 people, will host meetings in an elegant and well-lit setting. Easily accessible from Charles de Gaulle and Orly airports (by train RER B, bus or taxi), the hotel is also less than 10 minutes from Gare Saint-Lazare, Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est.

Name: Le Relais des Halles
Description: Completely renovated, Le Relais des Halles has 19 rooms including a Suite that combines French chic with modern facilities. Located just steps from the Pompidou Centre/Beaubourg, and the Forum des Halles shopping centre, the hotel is convenient to all forms of transportation. In the historic heart of Paris, it occupies a 17th century building nestled amidst the pedestrian streets linking the Place du Chatelet and the Montorgueil neighbourhood.

Name: Hotel Exposition Tour Eiffel
Adress: 42 B rue du Theatre 15th Arr., 75015 Paris France
Description:
The Hotel de l'Exposition, a 3-star hotel in Paris, is located at the heart of the 15th arrondissement, where the workers involved in building the nearby Eiffel Tower had their lodgings. The moment you step into the reception area, the charm of the period paintings that decorate the walls begins to take effect. Produced in the 1950s, they have all been carefully restored. The large numbers behind the Pavillon (the hotel bar) recall the dates of the various expositions that have marked the history of the French capital. Among them, the 1889 universal exhibition which saw the birth of the Eiffel Tower, today the very symbol of Paris; the one in 1900 which inaugurated the first metropolitain underground line; the 1925 Art Deco Exposition at which the work of such innovative artists as Le Corbusier and Picasso were on show, and 1937, for Arts and Techniques... The theme of the hotel is echoed, further on, in a pretty showcase holding period photographs, books and items. Citroen car fans will enjoy sleeping in the vicinity of the former offices of the make of car with a chevron logo whose design office produced the famous Traction, 2 CV and DS. In an elegantly refined atmosphere, visitors can take advantage of all modern conveniences. Enjoy a moment spent in a corner of the cosy lounge, or order a drink from the bar (specially reserved for hotel patrons 24/24), perhaps taking advantage of the handsome collection of whiskies Le Pavillon has on offer. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but the breakfast buffet is served (7 to 10 am on weekdays, 8 to 10:30 am on weekends) in a very attractive vaulted room, with stone walls; one wall features a trompe-l'oeil painting on the theme of the Eiffel Tower.

Name: Hotel Parc St. Severin - Esprit de France
Adress: 22 rue de la Parcheminerie 5th Arr., 75005 Paris France
Description:
"A hotel in the center of the Quartier Latin, one of Paris-lovers’ favorite parts of Paris" Located in the center of the Quartier Latin, the Hotel Parc Saint Séverin overlook a peaceful pedestrian road amid the busy, intertwining lanes that date back to the Middle Ages. The Rue de la Parcheminerie takes its name from parchment merchants who worked here in the 14th century, when the trade was a prosperous one. The schools and students of the Latin Quarter came here to buy their parchment, making this a very busy street. Later Diderot’s first home in Paris in this street. Just a few minutes’ walk away, you can stroll past the booksellers on the quays of the Seine, discover Sorbonne University and the Saint-Michel Fountain and then the majestic Notre Dame Cathedral on the other bank. Picturesque Île Saint Louis and timeless Jardin du Luxembourg are also nearby, from the hotel. But beyond the historic situation of the site, it is the view over the rooftops of Paris, Notre Dame Cathedral, the church and cloister of Saint Séverin, the Panthéon and even the Eiffel Tower that give the Parc Saint Séverin Hotel its inimitable charm, at the heart of the 5th arrondissement, the romantic heart of Paris.

The Spa My Blend by Clarins, 1,500 sqm of ethereal white paradise, offers the ultimate urban escape for complete relaxation. With the longest swimming pool in a Paris Palace, personal trainers, a wide range of yoga and Pilates classes, a hammam, watsu basin and exclusive treatment rooms, this award-winning spa takes rejuvenation to another level. From the modern Japanese cuisine of Matsuhisa to the celebration of Italian regional food in Il Carpaccio restaurant, dining at Le Royal Monceau - Raffles Paris’ restaurants is a truly memorable experience.

Name: Hotel Opera Liege
Description:
The discreet charm of a townhouse in the 9th arrondissement, 9, rue de Liège is the site of a beautiful facade dating from the Haussmann era, and the address of the "Hôtel Opéra Liège". The sign for this 4-star hotel, which is situated near the Saint-Lazare railway station and the Opéra district, is so discreet that it is hardly noticeable. The hotel opened in late 2015. Transformed by some daring renovations, the 18th-century townhouse has been restored to its former brightness and glory, bathed in light and nature. A glass walkway leads from the entrance to the contemporary interior, suspended between sky and earth. With a clean design, the 48 bedrooms exude an atmosphere of serene well-being. Looking for the ultimate in luxury? The two duplex suites with private terraces open onto a tree-filled patio, featuring a rooftop space that can be privatised and a panoramic view of Paris! A business corner with Wi-Fi, a fitness room, a bar (30 seatings) and a patio are available for your convenience. The new hotel's distinct blend of history, design, and nature offers a charmingly original experience to those looking for refinement, peace and quiet, whether in town on business or for leisure.

Name: Hotel Cordelia
Description:
The hotel Cordelia is the place where romantic writers used to meet in the 19th century. In an elegant and relaxing atmosphere of serenity, Countess Cordelia of Greffulhe invites you to discover her 30 non-smoking and air conditioned rooms, all recently renovated. A harmony of shimmering colors combined with some historical eye winks and modern equipment. The courtesy of our staff will make your stay a special moment! The rooms are differently decorated but they stay true to style, each of the 30 rooms (Classic, Comfort and Privilege) have contemporary requirement and charm that inspire relaxation and serenity. Some rooms will surprise you with a flowered window. The hotel CORDELIA'S rooms inspire heaven and are placed in the heart of the world's business and fashion. They offer guests the assurance of a stay under the sign of comfort. All our rooms have the same level of technological equipment: • Direct Individual air conditioning • Direct Phone Line • Free WIFI connection • LCD TV with 56 satellite channels (CNN - Eurosport - BBC - RAI - etc.) • Individual safe • Courtesy tray - tea / coffee / kettle • National and international newspapers at your disposal • Hair - dryer and cosmetic mirror • Welcoming rank of products "Dream Thermal" • Mini bar • Desk • Luggage holder • Iron and an ironing board at your disposal • Other services: Room service 6pm/3am, laundry service Suite a la situation sanitaire Covid-1, l'Hotel Cordelia adhere au programme "Caring Attitude": Nous vous assurons de la mise en place des mesures sanitaires preconisees par l’Agence Nationale de Sante Publique. Un referent du protocole sanitaire est nomme en tant que garant des bonnes pratiques au sein de notre etablissement. Tous nos collaborateurs sont formes a ces nouvelles mesures, dans un souci partage de securite. Nos services sont adaptes pour limiter les interactions physiques (paiement sans contact, suppression des documentations, gestion differenciee des flux entrants et sortants…) Nous veillons a la qualite de l’ensemble de votre parcours en privilegiant des partenaires « Caring attitude ». Nous privilegions les conditions de reservation et d’annulation flexibles. Nous sommes attaches aux valeurs d’accueil et de bienveillance de Paris.

Name: Sonder Atala Champs-Elysees
Description:
Curtain up. Under a magnolia tree in a leafy Parisian courtyard, you're sitting with a glass of vin rouge in one hand and a pen in the other. You might be planning your sightseeing itinerary or jotting down a shopping list for the luxury stores of the Champs-Élysées. But you feel like Simone de Beauvoir, Albert Camus, Édith Piaf on a night off. Atala invites you to be theatrical and you're ready to take the stage. The unmissable art-deco exterior is mirrored in the elongated lettering on the entrance. Dark marble flooring sets a sumptuous scene to your stay. Artwork spills from the lobby walls to the original sculptures of the secluded garden. Time to see where the City of Light gets its name. Watch the dazzling display of the evening Eiffel Tower from the parapet of the Arc de Triomphe, mere moments away. Turning towards the avenue, let your eyes dance through the Jardins des Champs-Élysées right to the pyramid of the Musée du Louvre.

Name: Hotel Elysa Luxembourg
Description:
The heart of the Latin Quarter beats just a short step away: the Luxemburg gardens, boulevard Saint-Michel, the Sorbonne, Notre-Dame and the Pantheon are all in the vicinity. Lovers of Old Paris who enjoy strolling through these streets steeped in history will appreciate the comfortable, typically Parisian setting of the Elysa-Luxembourg Hotel in the Latin Quarter. Sheltered from the bustle of the busiest thoroughfares, the Elysa-Luxembourg hotel combines the charm of a beautiful old stone building, the cosy interior of rooms decorated in contemporary style with the efficiency of modern facilities. Some of the thirty rooms offer a magnificent view over neighbouring rooftoops, the paths through the nearby Luxemburg gardens or even the Eiffel Tower. In this discretely refined setting, the atmosphere is decisively warm and the service resolutely attentive.

Description:
See why so many travelers make Le Petit Madeleine Hotel their hotel of choice when visiting Paris. Name: Hotel Le Marcel Paris Gare de l'Est
Description:
Affirm your "Avant-gardisme" by staying at the Marcel. A typical Parisian Bourgeois-bohemian Hotel, located in a young and dynamic district of the capital. A nod to Proust's Madeleine and a haven of peace, between the Gare du Nord and the Gare de l'Est.At a first glace, a modern façade, out of sync with the rest of the neighbourhood : One only sees the hotel. As the doors open, you step into a bubble, cut off from the exterior world. A well-known land-mark to Parisians, the Marcel hotel welcomes you upon your escapade to the capital and offers a perfect place to sleep for business travellers. The avant-garde décor was the work of the designer Claudia Del Bubba, who also worked on the Jules Verne (Gourmet restaurant on the Eiffel Tower).

Name: Fraser Suites Le Claridge Champs-Elysees
Adress: 74 avenue des Champs Elysees, 75008 Paris France
Description:
Le Claridge Champs-Elysées, built in 1914 right on the Champs-Elysées Avenue, has been witness to a century of political and romantic history of France. Secrets kept forever behind the walls of this legendary palace which has welcomed so many stars. A century later, Le Claridge Champs Elysées and its facade became listed French historical monuments, entering into the world of the most beautiful hotel residences in the world. The renovation changed this historical establishment into a contemporary, elegant Parisian residence. Spacious and comfortable, the110 Suites and apartments offer an exceptional view of the Champs Elysées Avenue or the peaceful patio of the residence. The blend of black and beige in the wall-to-wall carpeting evoke the black and white checkered pattern of the Parisian townhouses and the play of blue bands painted on the walls creates a unique ambiance. Wild silk curtains, velvet chairs, wool rugs and leather bring back the luxury of Claridge’s past glory. This is a new era for the Claridge Champs Elysées which, in 2006, joined the prestigious Fraser Suites collection.

With the same name as the famous Chat Noir Cabaret, our hotel has contemporary decor with red and black tones. Each floor of the hotel is dedicated to a famous writer or poet from the cabaret period. Ours guest rooms at the Le Chat Noir Design are decorated in an original style and are air-conditioned, TV Flat screen, italienne shower. Some of the rooms have a balcony or offer panoramic views of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is serviced by an elevator and the front desk is open 24 hours a day. We welcome you in a quiet and cozy atmosphere in the heart of one of the liveliest districts of the capital, so you just "lovez" in our hotel

Name: Hotel Val Girard
Description:
Hotel Val Girard is a haven of peace in the centre of Paris, ideally located in the heart of the Vaugirard area, between the exhibition centre at the Porte de Versailles, the Eiffel Tower, and Montparnasse.Surrounded by three town parks, our hotel is just a short distance from the famous shopping venue of the Rue du Commerce, where you will find all the big names and a host of small shops, from the Rue Vaugirard with its brasserie restaurants, and from the lively Convention area.The hotel is close to the ‘Vaugirard’ metro station, so you can reach most of the best tourist sites in Paris very quickly. (Direct routes to the Montparnasse, Madeleine, and Pigalle areas and to Montmartre-Sacré Cœur.)Hotel Val Girard has been refurbished throughout in a contemporary style, in bright colours, with modern furnishings. It offers 38 quiet, comfortable rooms, with views of either the Eiffel Tower or a tree-planted courtyard.Our team is at your disposal, ready to help you and to make sure you enjoy your stay in the capital.

Thanks to his very convenient location, you'll be able to move anywhere in Paris from the Republique Square (2 min. walking along the Avenue de la République). Indeed, at the metro station "Republique" you'll find 5 metro lines, which are the lines 3, 5, 8, 9 & 11. (and more bus lines, specifically the line 20 that goes to Gare de Lyon station, and the line 96 which goes to Montparnasse station.) This nice and quiet area offers every facilities : market, supermarket, bakery, pharmacy, parking lot nearby, laundry, and many bars and restaurants. All our rooms are non-smoking double rooms (max. occupancy 2 people), with air conditionning and free wifi access. For any further informations, do not hesitate to contact, day and night, our polyglot team (except french, we speak English, spanish, russian, portugese, italian, serbian..), which would be pleased to help you. Name: Citadines Opera Paris
Description:
elegant 2nd district, between the Drouot auction house and the Opéra-Comique national opera company. The area boasts some of the finest examples of Haussmann's work, many of which have been chosen by banking institutions for their headquarters. Between the bustle of the Grands Boulevards and the serenity of rue Favart, the quiet of your Apart Hotel will astonish you. Several metro lines and RER line A will make getting about easy. The Gare Saint-Lazare railway station is less than a quarter of an hour away Our reception is open both day and night. The unassuming entrance leads to a peaceful patio. Always lively, the area is swarming with restaurants and shops. The countless boutiques of the Verdeau or Choiseul passages, Galeries Lafayette and Printemps provide the ideal opportunity to both perfect your wardrobe and stay in the vanguard of Parisian fashion. Wander along the wide pavements of the Boulevard Haussmann. Follow the Boulevard des Italiens direct to the Place de l'Opéra: the Opéra-Comique itself is on the doorstep of your serviced apartments hotel. But perhaps you would prefer a trip to the Grand Rex cinema or a performance at the Edward VII theatre? The Palais Brongniart, a temple to finance in the 19th century and now a conference centre, is just five minutes away. The Louvre, Place de la Madeleine and Place de la Concorde are scarcely further. The Grévin museum waxworks awaits less than five minutes from your Apart Hotel. Whether your stay is to be short and busy or long and leisurely, Citadines Opéra Paris will provide you with all the space and facilities you could need during your time with us. Its studios and serviced apartments are fully equipped with kitchen areas with dishwasher, flat-screen LCD TVs with international channels, complementary WiFi, and more. And to help you feel at home, the Apart'hotel offers a whole range of à la carte services that include buffet breakfast, dry cleaning, private car park, laundry and daily housekeeping.

Name: Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Hotel
Description:
Please, note that the Hotel will be under renovation as of January 3rd for a period of 5 months. This may impact your experience, but be sure that we will remain fully available for your well-being during this period. -- Bask in the sumptuous elegance of France's magical capital city in grand fashion with carefully chosen amenities and 5-Star award-winning service at Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Hotel. We invite you to experience our exceptional location on Paris' most famous thoroughfare downtown near the Arc de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre and the Musée d'Orsay. In the evening, enjoy the local Parisian nightlife or settle into your beautifully designed hotel accommodations with a range of luxury amenities including pillowtop bedding, marble bathrooms and 24-hour room service. Additional perks include a modern fitness center and delectable dining at our new terrace, the M Bistro. Be sure to savor a few drinks at Bar Atrium, which showcases our hotel's striking, seven-story skylight. Those planning events will appreciate our tasteful venues, including a ballroom that can accommodate 350 guests. We're dedicated to ensuring that your stay is completely unforgettable at Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Hotel.

The bar 'Le Colisee' awaits you for a relaxing moment and our Business Centre is at your disposal in the hall, with PC, fax and Internet facilities. A private parking lot with direct private access to the hotel via elevator is available to our guests:Situated opposite the underground Metro station 'Place d'Italie', in the heart of the 13th arrondissement of Paris, Alliance Place d'Italie is the ideal place to stay to discover the City of Light. The 'village de la Butte aux Cailles', the cultural and artistic district with its many cafes and charming restaurants is only a few steps from the hotel. Several prestigious cultural buildings are also close to our establishment, such as the 'Bibliotheque Nationale de France Francois Mitterrand', the 'Institut du Monde Arabe' and the Palais Omnisport de Bercy venue. This privileged situation is ideal for discovering Paris from the river Seine, also for visiting the typical Chinese, Mouffetard and Saint-Germain-des-Pres districts, or the shopping district close to the Opera. Situated in the Heart of South Pigalle between the Opera and Montmartre, close to Galerie Lafayette and Printemps. The Grands Boulevards and Moulin Rouge are close by.The building in stone has been built en 1914 in Haussmann Style. Description:
Looking for a place to stay in Paris? Then look no further than Kyriad Paris 13 - Italie Gobelins, a family-friendly hotel that brings the best of Paris to your doorstep. The rooms offer a flat screen TV, a desk, and blackout curtains, and getting online is possible, as free wifi is available, allowing you to rest and refresh with ease. Kyriad Paris 13 - Italie Gobelins features a 24 hour front desk, 24 hour check-in, and baggage storage. In addition, as a valued Kyriad Paris 13 - Italie Gobelins guest, you can enjoy breakfast buffet that is available on-site. Given the close proximity of popular landmarks, such as Latin Quarter (1.3 mi) and Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris (1.4 mi), guests of Kyriad Paris 13 - Italie Gobelins can easily experience some of Paris' most well known attractions. While in Paris, you may want to check out some of the restaurants that are a short walk away from Kyriad Paris 13 - Italie Gobelins, including Le Train Bleu (1.1 mi), Tour d'Argent (1.1 mi), and Les Papilles (1.0 mi). There is no shortage of things to do in the area: explore popular castles such as Luxembourg Palace, Castel Beranger, and Chateau de la Reine Blanche. We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Kyriad Paris 13 - Italie Gobelins as you experience everything Paris has to offer.

Name: Hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg
Adress: 4 rue de Vaugirard 6th Arr., 75006 Paris France
Description:
Fontaines du Luxembourg offers, elegance, subtlety and friendliness in an ancient residence, transformed by King Louis XIV to house his grooms. From this flourishing age, the Hôtel Fontaines du Luxembourg has retained purity and calm with its indoor patio covered in Virginia creeper, around which our lounge, reception area and rooms are arranged.Return to the charm of the past at breakfast time. A generous buffet is offered in an authentic vaulted room dating from the 17th century, where a 12th century pillar from the fortified walls erected by Philippe Auguste still remains.The hotel enjoys a central location in the Saint Germain quarter and right off the Latin Quarter.Enjoy a drink in the lounge or in the patio. Room service is available daily, free wifi access, bathrobes.

Name: Hotel Amelie
Description:
L'Amélie, our little charming hotel, with its atypical decoration and 16 rooms, conveniently located in the heart of the 7th district of Paris, only a few minutes' walk from the Eiffel Tower, the Seine, the Orsay Museum, the Rodin Museum, the Invalides, the Champs-Elysées and the Grand Palais, is perfect for a pleasant stay in one of Paris' best neighborhoods. L'Amélie Hotel offers different kinds of rooms : twin beds, double beds, and single bed. Each of our rooms have been decorated and customized differently so that each stay with us can be a whole new experience. We consider tasteful details as essential! From the breakfast room to the bedrooms, the walls are covered in art and poetry so that each part of the hotel tells a story. Paris is wonderful, and we believe that so should be your experience here. Our multilingual staff will always happily guide you so that your stay in Paris goes as best as possible in this dynamic neighborhood full of small restaurants and shops, all within walking distance. A buffet breakfast is served every day 7:00 to 10:00.

Name: Elsa Hotel Paris
Description:
Nestled in a Haussmann-inspired building built in 1872, ELSA, Charming Little Parisian Home has been fully renovated in 2021. Our decorator, Marie-Agnès LOUBOUTIN, has chosen beautiful and fine materials. Our rooms have been designed as cocoons where time vanishes for the full duration of your stay. With you in mind, we have created a gem where the spirit of the Parisian 30's is in the air. Flowers are omnipresent from the entrance of our Home. Japanese art, so popular at the time, is present in subtle touches in the bathrooms and shower rooms. Why ELSA? A little flashback… When Louis ARAGON was born, his mother owned a guesthouse in the Avenue Carnot. In the 30s, Elsa TRIOLET becomes and will remain Louis ARAGON’s muse. And here we are, the loop is complete.

Name: Hotel Victoire & Germain
Adress: 9 rue Gregoire de Tours, 75006 Paris France
Description:
Located in the very heart of Paris, in the Saint-Germain-des-Prés area, Hotel Victoire et Germain tries to carry the traditions of the Latin Quarter on. For you, we have recreated a cosy and confidential atmosphere, just like what it used to be in Sartre's and Simone de Beauvoir's days. Discover the treasures, secrets and history of Saint-Germain-des-Prés through unique illustrations in each room of this contemporary boutique hotel. Victoire and Germain, chic and bubbly Parisians, are brought to the foreground in cheerful, original water-colors. Explore the City of Light by simply looking at our 19th century hotel walls This six-story building has a total of 16 rooms, all equipped with air conditioning and showers tiled with white ceramic. Fine materials, raw light oak wood for the floors and furniture, high-quality fabric, excellent bedware and bright modern colors are characteristic of our 2 room categories : Standard & Deluxe.

Name: Hotel & Spa La Belle Juliette
Adress: 92 rue du Cherche Midi, 75006 Paris France
Description:
La Belle Juliette. The discreet luxury of a four-star hotel and the charm of an address that visitors and Parisians will give to their most demanding, cultured friends. In the pure Parisian tradition of Saint-Germain-des-Pres, the hotel is guided by a modern vision of romanticism and urban conviviality. Exceptional service with particular attention to hospitality, guests' well-being, calm and tranquility... All in the heart of bustling Saint Germain. Corinne and Pascal Moncelli, the owners of the hotel, have decided to breathe new life into an establishment that had been left to abandon on the rue du Cherche-Midi by telling the story - or rather stories - of a famous historical personality. This star of her time lived in the 19th century, frequented all the intellectuals and politicians of the era, was blessed with exceptional beauty, had an extraordinary love life and - above all - excelled in the art of receiving. The popular literary salon that she organised from the tender age of 15 attracted the greatest minds of the time and continued until her death, age 72! It is Juliette Recamier - famously known as La Belle Juliette - who gives her name to this new hotel.

Name: La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa
Description:
42 Avenue Gabriel, Your Parisian place of life Mid-way between Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honore and Avenue Montaigne, a stone's throw from the Champs-Elysees, where the heart of Paris beats. Nestled in a peaceful location, slightly set back from the world's most beautiful avenue, La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa overlooks the Grand Palais, the Eiffel Tower, the Pantheon and the Concorde obelisk. Just in front, a majestic curtain of trees preserves the intimacy of this place, like an echo of the Elysee gardens nearby. Michel Reybier's highly distinctive urban mansion has all the elegance of a 19th century private apartment, where ultra-personalized services can be enjoyed in complete simplicity and discretion. All around are immense spaces bathed in light, barely muted by the rich fabrics of the hangings. Scattered here and there are beautiful marble fireplaces, and everywhere the joy of vast indoor spaces, typical of Haussmann-style apartments. The noble and generous materials exude a forgotten spirit of generosity. More suites than rooms, a library reserved for guests and their friends, a smoking lounge, a 16-meter indoor pool (a rarity in Paris), wine cellars in the suites, an inner courtyard with lush greenery echoing the landscaped entrance. At La Reserve Paris - Hotel and Spa, you experience the quintessence of Parisian chic in the Belle Epoque.

Description:
The Hotel de la rue de Lille invites you to discover the Left Bank, its lifestyle, its history. A neighborhood of writers, singers and artists, the Saint Germain des Prés district, whith its caves and its unconventionality. A lifestyle, that of the Faubourg Saint Germain, with its old families dear to Proust. A history, that of the bi-millennial Left Bank marked in every stone. The Hotel de la rue de Lille, fully renovated, is one of those places where people like to settle down like at home, or better, as a VIP guest in an exceptional place. The rooms are all different. Designed by JL Bras, architect and designer, they have been renovated to the most modern standards, with warm materials and integrated libraries.

Name: Le Meurice
Description:
Le Meurice, an iconic address in the heart of Paris since 1835 Ideally located in the heart of Paris opposite the Tuileries Garden the very first Parisian palace is just steps from Place Vendome, the designer boutiques of rue Saint-Honore and minutes from the Louvre, Opera Garnier, Orsay Museum and other Parisian cultural jewels. Through the two Michelin-starred Restaurant le Meurice Alain Ducasse, with its exclusive Chef’s Table, Le Dali, which honors the famed painter and hotel guest, the very British Bar 228 and the private function rooms, the hotel proudly heralds a love of gastronomy. The 160 rooms and suites resemble 18th-century Parisian homes, embodying the quintessence of luxury. On the top floor, the Belle Etoile Royal Suite benefits from a 2,700-square-foot terrace, and its unparalleled 360-degree view offers an unforgettable experience, whilst the first floor Presidential Suites evoke the grandeur of Versailles.

Name: Louison Hotel
Adress: 105 rue de Vaugirard 6th Arr., 75006 Paris France
Description:
Situated between Saint Germain des Pres and Montparnasse, the Hotel LOUISON is a chic hotel in the centre of Paris. With nineteenth century furniture, cherry and chestnut tones on the walls, marble floors and a courtyard garden, the Louison hotel captures the spirit of the Left Bank in every detail. The hotel was constructed in 1856 to welcome the painters, sculptors and writers who would go on to put the Latin quarter at the very heart of European culture. This cultural heritage is present even in the bedrooms. Tastefully decorated, they generate a feeling of calm and a sensual ambiance. The charming, multilingual staff are always available to provide you with help and advice. They will be happy to offer local insight on art galleries, museums and the area's famous pavement cafes.

Name: Hotel Le Friedland
Adress: 177 rue du Faubourg Saint Honore, 75008 Paris France
Description:
Located in the heart of the 8th arrondissement of Paris for more than 25 years, The Hotel Le Friedland reopens its doors to its guests in an exceptional environment, just off the historic Champs-Elysees. Designed as a contemporary bourgeois house which combines the charm of an old Parisian home and the quality of the finest hotels. Its excellent location at the crossroads of the Friedland avenue and the Faubourg Saint-Honoré street makes it the perfect place to fully live your Parisian journey. From the entrance, the traveler is surprised by a big colorful stained-glass window that contrast with the peacefulness and serenity of the hotel. He can enjoy the elegant lounge with its magnificent embellished ceiling of great vaults all day long for his generous breakfast or a drink during the evening. Our rooms with lightly and soft hues, are decorated with refinement and simplicity: polished concrete bathroom, velvet and cane headboards and chairs, solid oak parquet. Paris is also well-known for its historical sites including Notre-Dame Cathedral, Catacombs of Paris and the Arc de Triomphe which are nearby the Hotel Le Friedland.

Name: Hotel des Saints-Peres - Esprit de France
Adress: 65 rue des Saints Peres, 75006 Paris France
Description:
"A peaceful hotel in the heart of Saint Germain des Prés quarter" The Hôtel des Saints Pères’ facade was built in 1658 in a classic style based on balance and measure, by Daniel Gittard, Louis XIV’s architect. It marks the beginning of the building’s history which became a hotel from the end of World War I. The private hotel offers guests peace and quiet away from the busy street outside with an outdoor patio shaded by trees and overlooked by the elegant rooms above, the most famous of which is decorated with a ceiling fresco from L'Ecole de Versailles. The exceptional work was an allegory which was ordered in 1666 by Pierre Abraham (Louis XIV’s butler), and depicts Intelligence watching the Augur being crowned by Virtue. Each room at the hotel has its own identity, expressed via the paintings and the engravings from the 17th and 18th centuries, when French Art was at its peak. The sculptured front wall, bas-reliefs, open beam ceilings and statues are also some of the elements that give the building such architectural character. It is ideally located in the center of Saint-Germain-des-Prés and artists such as Francis Bacon, the iconic Juliette Greco, pianist Alfred Brendel, writers such as Hervé Bazin and designers such as Tom Ford are just some of the famous people who enjoyed staying here.

Name: Au Boeuf Couronne Hotel
Description:
The Au Bœuf Couronné Hotel & Restaurant is located 15 minutes away from main international railway stations as Gare du Nord or Gare del l'Est, facing the "Parc de La Villette" (biggest green area in town) and its concert halls and exhibition centers. In our property you will find the perfect association between generous traditional french cuisine and modern hospitality comfort: you will be able to taste the most refined butcher cuts in a typical Parisian atmosphere, take advantage of many cultural events going on in the neighborhood and peacefully relax in one of our 42 rooms with up-to-the-time finishings. An underground station is just in front of the property and the Parisian ring road just 150 meters away, perfect balance between green environment and easiness of movements whenever you will have to join downtown, either for business or leisure. Take advantage of the 55 hectares of the park and have a promenade all along its canal then have a sit in our private terrasse and enjoy a glass from our wine selection staying connected with hi-speed internet, cocooned by the courtesy of our staff and its efficient and careful service.

Description:
Le Grey Hotel is a 4 stars boutique hotel located in the 9th District, between Montmartre and the Opera Garnier, close to the Department Stores (Galeries Lafayette, Printemps), the Moulin Rouge and theaters. Liège metro station is only 100 m away and enables direct access to central Paris, the Louvre Museum, the Invalides and the Champs-Elysées. With its elegant carriage entrance, Le Grey Hotel, located in a quiet small street, appears as a sophisticated parenthesis in the heart of an authentic and lively quarter. Its great originality lies in this bold chromatic variation around the grey color which symbolizes the soul of the place. A palette of twelve refined and warm tones, a timeless waltz which turns it into a haven of peace. Le Grey Hotel has 33 rooms on 6 levels from Classic Single rooms (13sqm) to Privilege rooms (21 sqm). All of our soundproofed rooms offer the same services: air-conditioning, fiber WIFI, Flatscreen TV with international channels, safe, minibar,...

Description:

Housed within the former France Telecom building from the 1930s and masterfully restored by acclaimed designer Jean-Phillipe Nuel, Le Cinq Codet offers vast spaces, a feeling of cosy simplicity and 67 bedrooms evoke a unique and artistic loft experience. With an outstanding collection of art work, luxurious amenities, contemporary elegance, signature floor to ceiling bay windows and up to date in-room technology, Le Cinq Codet is the ideal setting for an unforgettable getaway experience.

Name: Hotel Le Pradey
Description:
The spirit of a location, the elegance of a place The Le Pradey hotel, tucked away on a tiny street near the Tuileries garden in a historical neighborhood overflowing with elegance, opens its doors to reveal a precious Paris. Between the great Louvre Museum and the glamorous rue Saint Honoré, anything you could wish for is just a few steps away. Discover the most inspired, intimate settings of a pure, serene address. A mineral-toned clarity in noble, voluptuous materials, furniture with just the right touch of modernity, charming, calm corners and muffled well-being with fragrant softness: the hotel Le Pradey's 19 rooms and 9 junior suites are devoted to perpetuating a seductive lifestyle. Pure luxury in some rooms, a Paris balcony or surprise themes in others and, of course, attention to detail in every room.

Name: Le Roch Hotel & Spa
Description:
An iconic and discreet 5-star hotel, embodying Parisian chic, Le Roch Hotel & Spa is the ideal place to escape for a break in a private residence: a boutique hotel reinventing the codes of luxury, on a human scale, without excess or ostentation. We owe its design to the very Parisian decorator Sarah Lavoine. The wellness area offers you serenity and calm to relax by the pool bathed in natural light, stay in the best of your shape thanks to our fitness room equipped with state-of-the-art equipment, or escape to our hammam hidden behind a water veil. Enjoy a massage in the CODAGE Suite, which offers a facial and body care card. Le Roch restaurant offers an elegant and creative menu that comes to life thanks to our Executive Chef Remy Bererd. You will find in our menu a delicious answer to your culinary needs.

THE FIRST ART-GALLERY HOTEL IN PARIS We invited photographer Thierry des Ouches to decorate the hotel with his breathtaking photography. Based on 112 original prints that are displayed throughout the hotel, in the lobby and rooms and his film "Paris" which is screened in the reception. We've created this hotel with extreme attention to detail and a focus on guest experience. With it's ideal location in Saint Germain, not only is the hotel's decoration unique, it's location in Paris' most exciting neighborhood, makes it the best of both worlds (great decoration and great location). Name: Hotel Plaza Athenee
Description:
The Hôtel Plaza Athénée is simply made to be photographed, with its views of the Eiffel Tower and La Cour Jardin, its oasis of greenery, and even the 1,900 red geraniums gracing the façade. Inside, chic Art Deco and classical Parisian rooms are each as unique as the city that surrounds them. This is where a century of designers and artists have found their inspiration, including Christian Dior, who chose to open his first spa at the hotel. La Cour Jardin is the centre of life at the hotel, where guests can explore pop-up exhibitions, enjoy seasonal al fresco dining or take a twirl on the enchanting ice rink in winter, when the courtyard is transformed into a twinkling winter wonderland. The 550 employees include 80 experts in floristry, baking, carpentry and even the preparation of fresh fruit. They’re ready and waiting to make your stay a wonderful one.

This very special store and hotel stands at the heart of the 8th Paris arrondissement, and is conceived as a tribute to women and to that most precious of jewels; a diamond. The hotel is close to the Opera, the department stores on the Boulevard Haussmann and the place de la Madeleine, and is the ideal starting point for discovering the Centre de Paris and its famous monuments. After a day's shopping or a working session in the hotel seminar space, the bar lounge and hotel terrace welcome you for a moment's relaxation protected from the bustle of Paris life.

Name: Maison Nabis by HappyCulture
Description:
The Maison Nabis was designed for a total experience ; a pocket palace which is both artistic and nocturnal, intimate and unusual. A small living room, a patio and thirty rooms only, spread over six floors, and declined in six dominant colors: deep green, bordeaux, blue ink, absinthe, black or beige. Everywhere the visitor follow a guiding thread: the Belle Epoque’ audacity and chic style. This coquettish house has the clear curves and the free spirit of the Art Nouveau movement : a small chat room - a bright patio with a stain glass window - graphic rooms with origami vegetal pattern - marble bathrooms and retro taps. Nestled in the heart of the city of light, the Maison Nabis is two steps away from the emblematic and festive Pigalle.

Free WiFi, Business corner with printer, French and international press, shoeshine machine ...Overlooking the street or the courtyard, our rooms are equipped with free WiFi, hospitality tray, flat screen TV, air conditioning, safe, marble bathroom with hair dryer, wardrobe, luggage rack, ... Breakfast is served in your room or near the fireplace in the breakfast room between 7:00 am and 11:00 am. Saint-Germain des Pres is the perfect starting point for discovering Paris.
